title: Structure-Based Development of a Novel Macrocyclic Peptide to Disrupt the Lumican-Collagen I Interaction in Liver Fibrosis.
abstract: Liver fibrosis is a common and severe hepatic disorder characterized by the excessive accumulation of Collagen I. Lumican, an extracellular matrix protein, plays a critical role in collagen fibril assembly and contributes to progression. However, macrocyclic peptide-based inhibitors of this interaction remain largely unexplored.
